ygData.subject: RE: Missed notes (OT Rant)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I agree, with the additional point that if the GM s think its too much trouble to come and trade the items to me, then they should not be a GM, because
ygData.messageBody:
>The problem appears to be fixed now so the point is moot, but I think that's
>totally absurd that they encourage begging and twinking when it's extremely
>easy to see what level you are, and that you don't have any food, water or
>at the least, a default weapon. Now, if the GM's giving you your items back
>requires that they come to you, and trade the items to you then I can
>understand them not wanting to travel for hours to hundreds of people doing
>that. But if it's just a matter of typing something like "give equip #104
>player_name" then there's no reason for them not to have done it.

I agree, with the additional point that if the GM's think its too much
trouble to come and trade the items to me, then they should not be a GM,
because they either volunteered for the spot or they get paid for it.
Thankfully, the problem does seem to be over :)

>
>My main complaint (sorry, ranting here a bit) now is that on Veeshan (and
>other servers) it seems that we get a 2 minute warning whenever the server
>is going to go down. Last night a GM comes on and makes an announcement that
>the server is coming down - log off now. About a minute later he makes
>another announcement. Then less than a minute later the server goes down.
>Now excuse the heck out of me, but what about people in the middle of
>seriously hard fights or deep in a dangerous dungeon? How about fighting in
>the water in the Oasis? They're supposed to leave the fight, get out of the
>water sit and camp (without being chased & attacked) within a minute or two?
>Methinks not. My aggrivation comes after having sat on the boat for 20
>minutes, hitting the final zone to my destination and then the server going
>down before I could reach the dock or jump in the water. Server comes back
>up and guess what.. I'm in the OOT zone heading back to where I started,
>looking forward to another 30-40 minutes on the dang boat. Grrr.. A 10
>minute warning is all I ask. Is that so much? People on other servers said
>they get that, why can't Veeshan-ians?
>

Ouch, that hurts. For what it's worth, Brell players got the same kind of
notice that Veeshan players did: hardly any notice at all, I remember it
being something like "WORLD IS COMING DOWN, GET TO SAFETY AND LOG OFF NOW."
Sheesh.

Joseph M
